Tasks.Task Description: Identify the security requirements for the network, including inbound and outbound traffic rules, application needs, and compliance standards.
Define the rules for the Network Security Groups, including priority, source/destination IP ranges, protocols, and ports.
Provision Network Security Groups in the Azure portal, ensuring proper naming conventions and alignment with the design.

Tasks.Task: Associate NSGs with Subnets or NICs
Tasks.Task Description: Attach the NSGs to the appropriate subnets or network interfaces to enforce the defined security rules.
Enable additional security measures such as logging and diagnostics for NSG rule evaluation and traffic monitoring.
Validate the functionality of NSG rules by testing traffic flows and ensuring that the rules are applied correctly.
Set up monitoring and alerting for NSG activity using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to track rule hits and anomalies.
Create detailed documentation of the NSG setup, including rules, associations, and monitoring configurations.
Provide training to the operations team on managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting NSGs.
Conduct periodic audits to ensure NSG rules are compliant with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Periodically review all NSG rules to ensure they align with current security policies and organizational requirements. Remove any outdated or unnecessary rules.
Analyze NSG flow logs to identify unusual traffic patterns or potential security threats. Ensure logs are stored securely and accessible for auditing purposes.
Verify that NSGs are correctly associated with the intended subnets or network interfaces. Ensure no misconfigurations that could lead to security vulnerabilities.
Conduct regular compliance checks to ensure NSG configurations adhere to organizational and regulatory security standards.
Use Azure Monitor to track the performance and effectiveness of NSGs. Identify and address any bottlenecks or issues impacting network traffic.
Simulate failover scenarios to ensure NSGs function correctly during network disruptions or changes. Validate that traffic is appropriately filtered and routed.
If applicable, rotate any cryptographic keys or credentials associated with NSG configurations to maintain security integrity.
Perform drills to prepare for potential security incidents involving NSGs. Ensure the team is familiar with response protocols and procedures.
Analyze and optimize NSG rules to improve performance and reduce unnecessary complexity. Consolidate rules where possible.
Regularly back up NSG configurations to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
